name: Japanese Salted Chicken Wings
author: ZAYO
summary: Crispy, fried, salty chicken wings - Japanese-style! Delicious as a hot starter or snack eaten with soy sauce and fresh lemon juice.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Combine chicken wings, sake, garlic, sesame oil, ginger, dashi, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a large bowl
Cover with plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator to marinate, at least 1 hour
Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Place cornstarch in a shallow bowl
Dip marinated chicken wings in cornstarch and coat both sides
Fry chicken wings until crispy brown and crunchy on the outside and no longer pink at the bone, 10 to 15 minutes per batch
Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt and black pepper before serving
